intro: Bakerella poissonii subsp. parvibracteata, commonly known as the narrow-bract bakerella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to southern Africa, this plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow bracts and compact growth habit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
